dmca.title: Infringing Domain Name Registrations
dmca.body:
Dear Sir or Madam:

We represent the American Express Company and its related companies.  It has come to our attention that your company has registered and is using the domain names americanexpresslimit.com, limitamericanexpress.com, amexlimit.com and limitamex.com in connection with active websites offering unauthorized links to third party competitor websites offering charge card and other financial services. 

Our client is the owner of federal trademark registrations for the AMERICAN EXPRESS and AMEX trademarks, specifically Registration No. 1,024,840 registered on November 11, 1975, and Registration No. 1,161,278 registered on July 14, 1981.  American Express began using its AMERICAN EXPRESS mark in 1850, and its AMEX mark in 1969.  The American Express Company also uses its AMERICAN EXPRESS mark in connection with its Internet web site at americanexpress.com.  American Express has continuously and extensively used and advertised its AMERICAN EXPRESS and AMEX trademarks, making them famous in the United States and worldwide.  As such, the AMERICAN EXPRESS and AMEX trademarks are valuable assets of our client, ones they will take all reasonable steps to protect.

Unauthorized registration and/or use of AMERICAN EXPRESS, AMEX,  and the referenced domain names is likely to cause confusion, mistake, or to deceive the public and is a violation of our client's federally-protected rights under 15 U.S.C.
